title: Gabriel-Vincent Thévenard
text:
Gabriel-Vincent Thévenard (10 August 1669 – 24 August 1741) was a French <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="baritone">baritone</a> ("basse taille").
Thévenard was born at <a href="Orl%C3%A9ans">Orléans</a> or possibly Paris. Arriving in Paris in 1690, he studied under the <a href="composer">composer</a> <a href="Andr%C3%A9%20Cardinal%20Destouches">André Cardinal Destouches</a> and went on to become a member of the <a href="Acad%C3%A9mie%20Royale%20de%20Musique">Académie Royale de Musique</a>. He was notable for playing tragic roles that made use of his skill at declamatory <a href="recitative">recitative</a>s. He appeared in over 80 <a href="trag%C3%A9die%20en%20musique">tragédies en musique</a> and <a href="op%C3%A9ra%20ballet">opéras ballet</a> before finally retiring in 1729. He died in Paris.
